I thought the SP1 might be extractable from the DVD. How come the big size anyway? My DL-Version has zipped 91MB!

@blindchicken

As for SP1 with this, it won't work on the download version. I downloaded it from the JustFlight forums and tried to apply it to the DL version of this I got from here. Didn't work, it asked me for the correct DVD or something along those lines. 

Now someone might be able to crack that and make it work with the DL version I don't know, but until that happens, I would just say download this if you aren't already.

If you want to try it, just go to the JustFlight forums and download the patch. Maybe somehow it will work on yours.

As for the size difference, couldn't tell you and I was wondering the same thing. Heck, the DL version I have is only 51megs zipped. But I don't have the load editor, panel confguration utility or any of the liveries.
About the size: it is Just Flight's way to fill a DVD with a lot of crap, like trailers of other add-ons. Something you'll have to live with ;-)

Yes, how do you install?
PHBFO  read the readme . You need Alcohol 120 to mount the image into a virtual drive . then you should install the SP1 . Apparently I am the only one getting an error with the Patch.

Yes I've read the Readme, and I also downloaded Alcohol 120, but I still don't get it. Is there a tutorial somwhere?
And I also get that error.
Ok I've figured out how to install this and I never got the error when installing the patch either. Thanks PopArt!!!

PHBFO You need to use the image to mount a Virtual Drive.  Open alcohol 120% . select Options Virtual Drive make sure at least one virtual drive is enabled  .

 Select one Virtual Drive Device (in my system is F: ) , Right Click on the device name [Look down   on the screen ] and select Mount image . Select the image and you should be fine.

This is the solution for anyone having the errors 5001 or 6001

Go to Program filescommon filesInstallShieldProfessionalRuntime and delete either the 0701 or 0700 folder or both
this shoulde solve the problem.
Regards Agent005 :)

The path was Program filescommon filesInstallshieldProfessionalRuntime
